speaker: Doctor
text: What other symptoms are you experiencing besides swelling and pain in your right ring finger?

speaker: Patient
text: I can't flex my right ring finger at the distal joint when I make a fist, and it hurts a lot at that joint. My finger also stays extended when I'm resting.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you experienced any recent injuries or trauma to your right hand or finger?

speaker: Patient
text: Yes, I injured my right ring finger while playing football two days ago. It got caught in another player's jersey, and he pulled away forcefully. That's when the pain and swelling started.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you noticed any bruising or discoloration around the injured area?

speaker: Patient
text: No, I haven't noticed any bruising or discoloration around my right ring finger. It's mostly just swollen and painful.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you experienced any numbness or tingling in your right hand or fingers since the injury?

speaker: Patient
text: No, I haven't experienced any numbness or tingling in my right hand or fingers since the injury. It's just the pain and swelling in my right ring finger.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you been able to move your finger at all since the injury, or is it completely immobile?

speaker: Patient
text: I can move my finger a little, but it's very painful, especially at the joint. It feels like I can't flex it properly at all.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you taken any pain medication or applied ice to the injured finger since the injury occurred?

speaker: Patient
text: I haven't taken any pain medication yet, but I did apply ice to my finger for a little while to help with the swelling. It didn't seem to help much with the pain, though.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you noticed any changes in the range of motion in your finger since the injury, or has it remained the same?

speaker: Patient
text: I've noticed a significant decrease in the range of motion since the injury. I can barely move it, and trying to flex it causes a lot of pain.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you experienced any swelling in other fingers or joints, or is it isolated to your right ring finger?

speaker: Patient
text: No, the swelling is isolated to my right ring finger. The other fingers feel normal, and I haven't noticed any swelling in my joints.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you experienced any fever or chills since the injury occurred?

speaker: Patient
text: No, I haven't experienced any fever or chills since the injury. It's just the pain and swelling in my right ring finger.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you had any previous injuries to your right hand or fingers in the past?

speaker: Patient
text: No, I haven't had any previous injuries to my right hand or fingers before this incident. This is the first time I've experienced something like this.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you noticed any popping or clicking sounds when you try to move your right ring finger?

speaker: Patient
text: No, I haven't noticed any popping or clicking sounds when I try to move my right ring finger. It just feels stiff and painful.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you experienced any swelling or pain in your wrist or forearm on the same side as the injured finger?

speaker: Patient
text: No, I haven't experienced any swelling or pain in my wrist or forearm. The discomfort is only in my right ring finger.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you been able to use your right hand for daily activities since the injury, or has it been difficult?

speaker: Patient
text: It's been difficult to use my right hand for daily activities. Simple tasks like typing or holding things are painful and uncomfortable because of the injury.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you noticed any changes in the color or temperature of your right ring finger compared to your other fingers?

speaker: Patient
text: No, I haven't noticed any changes in color or temperature in my right ring finger compared to my other fingers. It feels similar in temperature, but it's just swollen and painful.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you experienced any joint stiffness or difficulty moving your finger in the morning or after resting?

speaker: Patient
text: I haven't noticed any stiffness in the morning or after resting. The pain and difficulty moving my finger are pretty consistent throughout the day.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you tried any specific movements or exercises to see if they help with the pain or swelling in your finger?

speaker: Patient
text: I haven't tried any specific movements or exercises yet because I'm afraid it will hurt too much. I've mostly just been keeping it still and resting.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you noticed any changes in the shape of your right ring finger since the injury, such as deformity or misalignment?

speaker: Patient
text: I haven't noticed any obvious deformity or misalignment in my right ring finger. It looks normal aside from the swelling, but it does feel stiff and painful when I try to move it.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you experienced any difficulty gripping or holding objects with your right hand since the injury?

speaker: Patient
text: Yes, I've had difficulty gripping and holding objects with my right hand. It hurts too much to apply pressure, especially with my ring finger.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you had any imaging done on your right ring finger, such as an X-ray, to check for fractures or other injuries?

speaker: Patient
text: No, I haven't had any imaging done yet. I was hoping to get some advice first before deciding if I need an X-ray.

speaker: Doctor
text: REQUEST TEST: X-Ray_Right_Ring_Finger

speaker: Measurement
text: RESULTS: No bone fractures or dislocations visible. Soft tissue swelling noted around the distal interphalangeal joint of the right ring finger.

speaker: Doctor
text: Maximum inferences reached

speaker: Patient
text: I appreciate the examination and the results. What are the next steps for treating my right ring finger?
